intro: Raoulia bryoides, commonly known as the rock lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically crustose or loosely attached to its substrate. The plant exhibits a pale green to yellowish-green coloration, often with a slightly pruinose surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, commonly found on rock surfaces in tropical and subtropical regions. Raoulia bryoides plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
